Direction générale de la protection civile et des opérations d'aide humanitaire européennes (ECHO)

title.narrative: Strengthening early warning and response capacities for tsunami and other coastal hazards in Central America

description.narrative: The project will be implemented by the UNESCO multi-country office in Costa Rica, in partnership with the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission of UNESCO (UNESCO-IOC) and in coordination with national authorities in Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Panama and Costa Rica. CEPREDENAC will be the project counterpart for actions at regional level.This action aims at strengthening and institutionalizing the process and tools developed within the framework of the action "Building resilient communities and integrated early warning for tsunamis and other ocean related hazards in Central America" implemented in 2016-2017 with focus in Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras and Nicaragua. This action proposes to carry out activities in Panama and Costa Rica based on lessons learned from the previous project and the efforts underway in these countries. In addition, the project proposes innovative activities by the use of TICs to enhance warning dissemination and notification to exposed population and to apply the Tsunami Ready recognition process to 10 communities.The expected results of the project are:1. Disaster risk reduction and civil protection stakeholders and scientific institutions act in a coordinated manner for tsunami early warning through efficient activation of convened protocols, including the development of an application for warning notification to be used in phones;2. The Tsunami Ready Process is institutionalized in 6 countries, including the recognition of at least 10 municipalities and applying an inclusive and gender-sensitive approach;3. Preparedness and response capacities of authorities, population and school community are strengthened through innovative, inclusive and gender-sensitive approaches using formal, no-formal education
